org.apache.heron.instance

Interface IInstance

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BoltInstance, BoltInstance, SpoutInstance, SpoutInstance

    @InterfaceAudience.Private
 @InterfaceStability.Evolving
public interface IInstance
    Implementing this interface allows an object to be target of HeronInstance

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void activate()
      Activate the instance
      void clean()
      Clean the instance.
      void deactivate()
      Deactivate the instance
      void init(State<java.io.Serializable,java.io.Serializable> state)
      Initialize the instance.
      void onCheckpointSaved(java.lang.String checkpointId)
      Inform the Instance that a particular checkpoint has become globally consistent
      void persistState(java.lang.String checkpointId)
      Save the state and send it out for persistence
      void preRestore(java.lang.String checkpointId)
      Inform the Instance that the framework will clean, stop, and delete the instance in order to restore its state to a previously-saved checkpoint.
      void readTuplesAndExecute(Communicator<com.google.protobuf.Message> inQueue)
      Read tuples from a queue and process the tuples
      void shutdown()
      Destroy the whole IInstance.
      void start()
      Start the execution of the IInstance
      void update(PhysicalPlanHelper physicalPlanHelper)
      Update the instance.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init(State<java.io.Serializable,java.io.Serializable> state)
        Initialize the instance. If it's a stateful topology, the provided state will be used for initialization. For non-stateful topology, the state will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        state - used for stateful topology to initialize the instance state

      • start

        void start()
        Start the execution of the IInstance

      • clean

        void clean()
        Clean the instance. After it's called, the IInstance will be still alive but with an empty state. Before starting the IInstance again, an `init()` call is needed to initialize the instance properly.

      • preRestore

        void preRestore(java.lang.String checkpointId)
        Inform the Instance that the framework will clean, stop, and delete the instance in order to restore its state to a previously-saved checkpoint.
        Parameters:
        checkpointId - the ID of the checkpoint the instance will be restoring to

      • onCheckpointSaved

        void onCheckpointSaved(java.lang.String checkpointId)
        Inform the Instance that a particular checkpoint has become globally consistent
        Parameters:
        checkpointId - the ID of the checkpoint that became globally consistent

      • shutdown

        void shutdown()
        Destroy the whole IInstance. Notice: It should only be called when the whole program is exiting. And in fact, this method should never be called.

      • readTuplesAndExecute

        void readTuplesAndExecute(Communicator<com.google.protobuf.Message> inQueue)
        Read tuples from a queue and process the tuples
        Parameters:
        inQueue - the queue to read tuples from

      • activate

        void activate()
        Activate the instance

      • deactivate

        void deactivate()
        Deactivate the instance

      • update

        void update(PhysicalPlanHelper physicalPlanHelper)
        Update the instance. This happens when the physical plan changes (e.g., during a scaling event)
        Parameters:
        physicalPlanHelper -

      • persistState

        void persistState(java.lang.String checkpointId)
        Save the state and send it out for persistence
        Parameters:
        checkpointId -
